page.title: 12ST.LUKE'S CHURCH,NORTH KYME
page.content: The church was built in 1877 by Lincoln builders and the man in charge was Mr.A.Knight.The men who decied that a church should be built were {Edward Jackson,Samuel Coulson, Mr. {Forman,Mr.Watson and Rev.Edward Garvey who all met one night in the Plough Inn to discuss it.The cost of the building was Â£1160.There is one bell in the church and a pipe organ. The font is made of Ancaster stone.At the east end is a stained glass window which was presented by{Edward Jackson who was also the first man to be buried in the Churchyard. The Church was consecrated by the Bishop of Lincoln.About 20-25 people attend each service and these are led by the present vicar,Rev.R.Abraham. There are special services at Easter,Harvest, and Christmas as well as Songs of Praise services.
